title: What is the symbolism behind the fasting and purification rituals during different times of the year?
first_phrase: In this last part, the symbols and rituals of fasting and purification times in the year are explained, with instructions for the calculation of lunar fasts. The author explains that the four annual fasts correspond to the four solar seasons, but vary based on lunar cycles. Specific rules are given for the start and end times of each fast, including "residual" periods before and after the fast. It is also noted that those who are ill are exempt from fasting, except for salt, water, and vinegar. Finally, it is explained that lunar fasts have more relaxed rules and allow for animal products before sunset.
